articles.title: Kim Jong Il Gives Field Guidance to Samilpho Special Products Factory
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Gives Field Guidance to Samilpho Special Products Factory
Pyongyang, April 7 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il gave field guidance to the Samilpho Special Products Factory managed by the army.
					 This factory standing on the bank of the Taedong River is a general foodstuff processing base which produces foodstuffs of more than 350 varieties including noodles, rice-cakes, cooking oil, confectionery, tea, processed local farm products and processed fish.
					
					After being briefed on the factory before a huge map showing a panoramic view of the factory,
						Kim Jong Il looked round the production processes for a long while to acquaint himself in detail with the technical equipment and production.
					
					 Watching various kinds of foodstuffs being churned out in an unbroken chain, he expressed great satisfaction over the fact that cultured practices are fully ensured in production and life and production is kept going at a high rate. 
					
					 He said that the Samilpho Special Products Factory is a profitable factory as it produces a lot of peculiar foodstuffs entirely in reliance upon locally available raw materials and a model factory which has successfully implemented the WPK's policy on the light industrial revolution including the packing revolution. He extended his sincere thanks to its employees. 
					
					 This factory is an excellent factory which fully meets the requirements of the IT age in all aspects, he noted, adding that this shining success is the precious fruition of the noble spiritual world of the KPA and people who live not merely for today but for tomorrow with ardent patriotism.
					
					  The People's Army is successfully playing a core and vanguard role in the on-going general offensive to open the gate to a great prosperous and powerful nation like the creator of the revolutionary soldier spirit, he said, highly appreciating the feats performed by the servicepersons intensely loyal to the Party. 
					
					 He met with the persons of merit who have devotedly worked for the development of the factory for years since the outset of its construction and warmly encouraged them. He had a photograph taken with them. 
					
					 He called on all provinces to build lots of similar factories to contribute to improving the standard of people's living. 
					
					 Then he provided field guidance to the Samilpho Special Products Shop operated by the above-said factory. 
					
					 There he underscored the need to improve the service to meet the intrinsic requirements of socialist commerce and specified ways to do so. 
					
					 He set forth important tasks which would serve as guidelines for managing and operating the factory. 
					
					 Noting that it is the will and determination of the Party to provide the best things to the people, he stressed the need for the factory to continue paying deep attention to bringing the quality of foodstuffs to the best level. 
					
					 He was accompanied by KPA Generals Hyon Chol Hae and Ri Myong Su and other commanding officers of the army, Secretary Kim Ki Nam and Department Directors Jang Song Thaek, Choe Ik Gyu and Kim Yang Gon of the WPK Central Committee.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Sends Wreath to Bier of Kim Kon Il
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Sends Wreath to Bier of Kim Kon Il
 Pyongyang, April 7 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il on Tuesday sent a wreath to the bier of the late Kim Kon Il, composer of the State Merited Chorus, expressing deep condolences over his death.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Sends Wreath to Bier of Ko Hak Rim
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Sends Wreath to Bier of Ko Hak Rim
 Pyongyang, April 7 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il Monday sent a wreath to the bier of the late Ko Hak Rim, people's artiste and former director at the Korean Film Studio, expressing deep condolences over his death.

articles.title: Celebration Events Held by Working People's Organizations
articles.content:
Celebration Events Held by Working People's Organizations
Pyongyang, April 7 (KCNA) -- Meetings were held by workers and trade union members at the plaza of the Monument to Party Founding, by youth and students at the Central Youth Hall, by agricultural workers on the Migok Cooperative Farm of Sariwon City and by women's union members at the plaza of the Arch of Triumph on April 6 and 7 on the occasion of the 16th anniversary of Kim Jong Il's election as chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK.
					 Present there were Kim Jung Rin, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, officials of the trade union, the youth league, the union of agricultural workers and the women's union, working people, youth and students.
					
					 Kim Pyong Phal, chairman of the Central Committee of the General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea, Ri Yong Chol, first secretary of the C.C., the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League, Kang Chang Uk, chairman of the C.C., the Union of Agricultural Workers of Korea, and Ro Song Sil, chairperson of the C.C., the Democratic Women's Union of Korea, made reports at the meetings to be followed by speeches.
					
					 The reporters and speakers said that Kim Jong Il's election as chairman of the NDC provided a sure guarantee for creditably carrying forward President Kim Il Sung's idea of building the national capability for self-defence and his original cause of nation-building and accomplishing the revolutionary cause of Juche that started on Mt. Paektu.
					
					 They stressed the need to wage a dynamic drive for bringing about a new great revolutionary surge in the production and construction, breathing the same breath as Kim Jong Il does in his forced march.
					
					 They recalled that the young vanguard has grown to be the forerunners in the era and performers of feats under the care of the peerlessly great man who ushered in a great heyday of the Juche-based youth movement with his politics of attaching importance to arms and the youth.
					
					 Noting that under the care of Kim Jong Il the material and technological foundation of the rural economy has been further consolidated, a boost effected in the agricultural production and the countryside of the DPRK changed into a socialist land of bliss in the era of Songun, they underlined the need to bring about a new great revolutionary surge in the agricultural production this year.
					
					 They called upon the women's union members to do a lot of good things conducive to building a great prosperous and powerful nation and bravely turn out in the present general advance to give full play to the stamina of the women of Songun Korea.
					
					 The participants at the meetings listened to poems "Pledge Made by Young Vanguard to the Great Brilliant Commander of Songun" and "We Will Uphold the Cause of Songun of Our Party with Rice" and group poem "We Will Dash like the Wind under the Leadership of the Brilliant Commander of Songun."

articles.title: Mangyongdae Prize Sports Contest Opens
articles.content:
Mangyongdae Prize Sports Contest Opens
 Pyongyang, April 7 (KCNA) -- The Mangyongdae Prize sports contest was opened with due ceremony at the Basketball Gymnasium in Chongchun Street Tuesday on the occasion of the anniversary of birth of President Kim Il Sung. 
					 The sports contest, an annual event, marks an important occasion in more significantly commemorating the Day of the Sun and developing the nation's sports technique. 
					
					 During the contest its participants will compete in nearly 40 events including football, basketball, boxing, shooting and speed skating to be held in Pyongyang, Sariwon, Hamhung, Phyongsong, Samjiyon and other places.
					
					  Present at the opening ceremony were Kim Jung Rin, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, officials concerned and sportspersons.
					
					 An opening address was made by Pak Hak Son, chairman of the Physical Culture and Sports Guidance Commission, to be followed by speeches .

articles.title: Songhwa Fine Art Exhibition Opens
articles.content:
Songhwa Fine Art Exhibition Opens
 Pyongyang, April 7 (KCNA) -- The Songhwa Fine Art Exhibition was opened at the Pyongyang International Cultural Center Tuesday to commemorate the Day of the Sun.
					 On display in the venue of the exhibition are more than 70 art works created by old painters across the country.
					
					 Korean paintings "Visiting Mangyongdae in April" and "Site of Headquarters in Konchang Bivouac", oil painting "Mangyongdae in Spring" and other works deal with the noble ideological and moral world of the Korean people to hold President Kim Il Sung in high esteem and follow him for all ages. 
					
					 Among them are Korean paintings "Lake Chon on Mt. Paektu" and "Jong Il Peak Shines", oil paintings "The Shore of Lake Samji" and "Osan Hill in Spring" and other works representing the will of all servicepersons and people to eternally glorify the immortal exploits the three commanders of Mt. Paektu performed by laying an eternal foundation for the prosperity of the country and the nation.
					
					  Also on display are art pieces introducing the worksites in different fields of national economy seething with a high-pitched drive for bringing about a great revolutionary surge.

articles.title: Red Cross Spring Tree-Planting Event Held
articles.content:
Red Cross Spring Tree-Planting Event Held
 Pyongyang, April 7 (KCNA) -- A Red-Cross spring tree-planting event took place in Ryonghung-ri, Songchon County, South Phyongan Province, Tuesday on the occasion of the all-people movement for spring land management.
					 Present at the event were officials of the DPRK Red Cross Society, juvenile members of the Red Cross Society and members of the delegation of the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies working in the DPRK.
					
					 At the event speakers referred to the brisk spring tree-planting in the DPRK during the all-people movement for spring land management, adding that this event took place as part of Red Cross activities for preventing disaster.
					
					 The participants planted pine-nut, acacia and other trees.

articles.title: World Health Day Marked
articles.content:
World Health Day Marked
  Pyongyang, April 7 (KCNA) -- A function took place in Pyongyang Tuesday on the occasion of World Health Day.
					 Present there were officials of the Ministry of Public Health, working people's organizations, ministries, national institutions and media, public health workers in Pyongyang and members of the missions of international organizations including the WHO here.
					
					 It was addressed by Ri Pong Hun, vice-minister of Public Health, and Sarveshwar Puri, representative of the WHO.
					
					 They said that the "Health facilities in emergencies", the theme of World Health Day this year, call on the health institutions and workers to take practical actions in case of emergency. 
					
					 Satisfactory and effective services of the health facilities when urgent medical help is required are of weighty importance in rescuing residents' lives, they added.
					
					 They expressed expectation that the events held on the above-said day would be helpful to the activities of the WHO and the international community.
					
					 Then its participants watched a video "Health Facilities in Emergencies."
					
					 There was a lecture on the subject "Disasters and first-aid treatment" at the event.

articles.title: Food Festival Held on April Holiday
articles.content:
Food Festival Held on April Holiday
Pyongyang, April 7 (KCNA) -- The 14th April Holiday Food Festival took place here on Monday and Tuesday.
					 It brought together more than 40 excellent units across the country. The festival was held by way of national dish and holiday food exhibition, competition of the technology and skill of cooks and waiters and waitresses, food services competition and exhibition of information on achievements made in the field of cuisine science and technology, divided into the popular services unit and the foreign services unit.
					
					Displayed there were at least 1,000 national dishes of special taste and several kinds of dishes cooked by service workers in various places of the country and 300 scientific research data.
					
					 Such special local dishes as noodle, potato and bean dishes, hairy crab and eel ones and such popular and spring food as steamed corn bread, sliced vegetables preserved in soy sauce and Kimchi well showcased the advantages of the Korean food culture developing in the era of Songun.
					
					 Drawing attention of experts and visitors were splendid tables on which delicious and nutritious dishes attractive in color and shape are in good harmony with models of vegetables.
					
					 Conspicuous were competition of technology and skill among cooks in slicing vegetables, making flower shapes and making sweet foods as well as competition showing refined skill and the spirit of devoted service of waiters and waitresses.
					
					 On display at the exhibition hall of information of achievements made in the field of cuisine science and technology were visual aids and multi-media programs showing the achievements made in the researches and designs and cooking utensils conducive to putting cookery on scientific and standard basis.
					
					 A closing ceremony was held at the People's Palace of Culture on Tuesday.
					
					 Present there were Ro Tu Chol, vice-premier of the DPRK Cabinet, Kim Pong Chol, minister of Commerce, officials concerned and participants in the festival.

articles.title: Preparations for 11th Kimilsungia Festival Brisk
articles.content:
Preparations for 11th Kimilsungia Festival Brisk
Pyongyang, April 7 (KCNA) -- Preparations for the 11th Kimilsungia Festival are going on in high gear in the DPRK with the Day of the Sun just around the corner.
					The Korean Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia Committee is leaving nothing short of perfection in preparing the festival to suit its mission and character, from arranging its venue to opening it to visitors, by pooling collective wisdom and efforts.
					
					It is pulling its weight on working out a peculiar design of the festival hall. It is successfully rounding off the design of the festival hall to bring into bold relief the theme of the festival: "Kimilsungia, the flower of the sun which will remain immortal in the hearts of humankind".
					
					And it is effectively organizing the work for the success of the festival. To help the units presenting flowers to the festival to be productive of results, it is giving substantial guidance to the planning of exhibition stands and it is acquainting itself with the cultivation of Kimilsungia at those units and giving them energetic technical guidance so they may bring the flower into fuller blossom.
					
					Lots of units participating in the festival are also astir with preparations.
					
					They are devoting their wisdom and zeal to present the flower of the sun to the festival in a more beautiful shape and bending efforts to make splendid exhibition stands. 
					
					Animated in the provinces are preparations to arrange exhibitions of the immortal flower and open the Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia greenhouses to visitors.
					
					The preparations for the festival are making a marked progress every day, spurred on by the boundless reverence and praises of the Korean people and the world progressives for President
						 Kim Il Sung growing more ardent with the passage of time.

articles.title: Preparations for Registration of More Historical Relics as World's Cultural Heritages under Way
articles.content:
Preparation for Registration of More Historical Relics as World's Cultural Heritages under Way
Pyongyang, April 7 (KCNA) -- The work for the registration of more historical remains as world's cultural heritages has been undertaken in the DPRK these years.
					 The Cultural Relics Conservation Guidance Bureau is now in close touch with the UNESCO to have famous historical relics in Kaesong, the capital of Koryo (918-1392), registered as world's cultural heritages through due formalities.
					
					 The Mausoleum of King Wang Kon, Mausoleum of King Kongmin, Nam Gate of Kaesong, Koryo Songgyungwan, Sungyang School, Sonjuk Bridge, Monument to Loyalty, Manwoltae, Kaesong Fort, Taehungsan Fort and Kwanum Temple have already been selected as objects to be registered.
					
					 Some time ago Minsok (folk) Street, the Chilrung Group of Tombs, the Myongrung Group of Tombs and the Kaesong Chomsongdae Observatory were newly added to the objects. The registration will give a perfect appearance to the old historical city in relation with diversified historical relics.
					
					 Along with the work of preserving and managing the objects well, efforts are being made to arrange a state legal guarantee for it.
					
					 The recommendation document for the registration of the objects as world's cultural heritages in accordance with the regulations and standard set by the UNESCO has already been made.
					
					 Sixty three Koguryo mural tombs including the Mausoleum of King Tongmyong, Yaksu-ri mural tomb, Tokhung-ri mural tomb, three tombs of Kangso and Anak Tomb No. 3 were put on the list of the world's cultural heritage at the 28th meeting of the World Heritage Committee of the UNESCO held in China in 2004.

articles.title: Overseas Compatriots Art Troupes Arrive
articles.content:
Overseas Compatriots Art Troupes Arrive
 Pyongyang, April 7 (KCNA) -- The art troupe of Koreans in Japan arrived here today by air to participate in the 26th April Spring Friendship Art Festival.
					 Arriving here earlier were the art troupes of Koreans in China and the International United Confederation of Koreans.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on Successful Satellite Launch
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun on Successful Satellite Launch
 Pyongyang, April 7 (KCNA) -- The successful launch of the satellite Kwangmyongsong-2 marks a historic event which fully demonstrated the national power of the DPRK and meant a gunfire heralding the victory in struggle for building a great prosperous and powerful nation, a significant event instilling great national pride and self-esteem into the Korean people and an event which made a great contribution to the peace and security of the world.
					 Rodong Sinmun today says this in an editorial. 
					
					 It goes on:
					
					  The satellite launch strikingly demonstrated the might of the Juche-based  industry which has grown strong despite stern trials and the level of the nation's science and technology and clearly proved that the DPRK's people's building a great prosperous and powerful nation is by no means an empty talk, the editorial notes, and goes on:
					
					 The satellite Kwangmyongsong-2 and carrier rocket Unha-2 developed by the DPRK are the shining products of Songun Korea as all elements ranging from their designing  to manufacture, assembling, a launching site and observation facilities are home made.
					
					 Scientists and technicians of the DPRK settled all the scientific and technological problems arising in the development and launching of the satellite by their own efforts with the extraordinary spirit of inquiry and the persevering will and put the nation's space technology on a world level.
					
					The DPRK's successful satellite launch is the shinning fruition of the Songun revolutionary leadership provided by General Secretary Kim Jong Il by directing his utmost efforts to boosting the nation's political and military potentials and developing the science and technology despite the worst trial and adversity, while foreseeing a bright future of the country.
					
					 The successful launch of the satellite Kwangmyongsong-2 is ascribable to the heroic endeavors the trustworthy scientists and technicians of the DPRK have made by devoting all their wisdom and energies to the prosperity of the country, remaining true to the Workers' Party of Korea with revolutionary faith and ardent patriotism.
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK will wage a more dynamic drive to bring about a fresh great revolutionary surge to build a great prosperous and powerful nation of Juche on their land without fail true to the Songun leadership of Kim Jong Il at any cost, while significantly hailing the successful launch of the satellite Kwangmyongsong-2.

articles.title: Aggressive Nature of U.S. Moves to Build Missile Shields Disclosed
articles.content:
Aggressive Nature of U.S. Moves to Build Missile Shields Disclosed
Pyongyang, April 7 (KCNA) -- No matter how craftily the U.S. tries to cover up the aggressive nature of the Missile Defense System (MD), its rhetoric can never convince anyone in this bright world today, says Rodong Sinmun Tuesday in a signed commentary.
					 Great irony is that the U.S. claims its criminal moves to build MD are aimed to ensure "its security" and "protect" allies from "threat" of someone, the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					 No matter how vociferously the U.S. may trumpet about "threat" from someone, no one will lend an ear to it as it is devoid of any scientific evidence or plausibility.
					
					 By spreading the above-said fiction the U.S. seeks to justify its nuclear and missile force buildup and moves to throw its MD network worldwide.
					
					 It is shameless for the U.S. to talk about "threat" from the DPRK as the former is putting spurs to the building of missile shields in a bid to put the world under its domination. 
					
					 No matter what rhetoric the U.S. may let loose about the "high rate of successful missile interception test" it can never cover up the vulnerability of the MD and the criminal aim lurking behind it. 
					
					 The U.S. is mistaken if it thinks that the MD is helpful to its "security."
					
					 By building missile shields in the Northeast Asian and European regions the U.S. imperialists seek to put China, Russia and other big powers under a military siege and contain those countries and thus achieve their wild ambition for putting the world under their domination by dint of military hegemony.
					
					 The U.S. moves for MD are criminal acts to disturb world strategic stability and spark off a fresh arms race and a nuclear war. 
					
					 The U.S. would be well advised to face up to the reality with cool head and stop its criminal moves to build MD.

articles.title: Lee Myung Bak Group's Racket of "Human Rights" against DPRK Lambasted
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak Group's Racket of "Human Rights" against DPRK Lambasted
Pyongyang, April 7 (KCNA) -- The Lee Myung Bak group of traitors is hatching a plot to fabricate the "law on human rights issue in north Korea" at the "National Assembly". This is an unpardonable treacherous act of denying the dignified idea and system of the DPRK and escalating confrontation between the north and the south as it is a sort of provocation made by the group of traitors obsessed with the ambition for confrontation with fellow countrymen. Newspapers Tuesday observe this in signed commentaries.
					 Rodong Sinmun says:
					
					 The Lee group is misleading public opinion trying to give impression that there exists the "issue of human rights" in the DPRK. This, however, will get it nowhere as it is a nonsensical ploy.
					
					 Very wicked is the Lee group's frenzy over "human rights" racket against the DPRK.
					
					 The Lee group is making desperate efforts to tarnish the bright image of Songun Korea to which the world progressive mankind desirous of independence is looking up and create an atmosphere hostile toward the DPRK at home and abroad but in vain. This is as foolish an act as trying to sweep the sea with a broom.
					
					 The Lee group's persistent "human rights" racket against the DPRK only compels it to harden its will not to deal with the group at all but to settle accounts with it to the last. If the Lee group persists in such reckless moves against the DPRK as now, it will be forced to follow in the disgraceful footsteps of traitor Kim Young Sam who was thrown into the dustbin of history, not having had a dialogue between the north and the south even a time during the whole period of his office being keen on confrontation with fellow countrymen.
					
					 The Lee group would be well advised to act with discretion, clearly understanding that its "human rights" racket against the DPRK will bring only a disgraceful ruin to it.
					
					 Minju Joson says that to do harm to the DPRK through the "human rights" racket against it is a foolish and stupid act which can never be realized. The Lee group should bear in mind that the said racket is as adventurous an act as lifting the axe to drop it on its own foot, the daily stresses.

articles.title: Anti-DPRK Outbursts of Commander of U.S. Forces in S. Korea Blasted
articles.content:
Anti-DPRK Outbursts of Commander of U.S. Forces in S. Korea Blasted
Pyongyang, April 7 (KCNA) -- The commander of the U.S. forces in south Korea at a recent hearing of the U.S. House of Representatives Armed Services Committee blustered that the military muscle of north Korea poses threats to the region and the world and that north Korea is a world's major exporter proliferating ballistic missiles and relevant technology and conventional weapons. He went the lengths of letting loose such vituperation that north Korea perpetrates provocative acts of threatening the U.S. and its allies, while describing its satellite launch as a long-range missile launch.
					 Commenting on this, Minju Joson Tuesday observes:
					
					 His accusation made against DPRK over its military capability only reminds one of a thief crying "Stop the thief!"
					
					 The U.S. is rounding off its strategy for a preemptive attack on the DPRK by waging war exercises under various codenames after setting the establishment of military hegemony on the Korean Peninsula as the core of its strategy for putting Asia-Pacific under its domination and amassing aggression troops and sophisticated military hardware in and around the peninsula.
					
					 As for the military power of the DPRK, it is just for self-defence as it is aimed to defend its sovereignty, dignity and security from the U.S. ever-more pronounced hostile policy toward the DPRK and its attempt to stifle the DPRK by force of arms.
					
					 The U.S. bellicose forces' smear campaign against the DPRK over its military capability was prompted by their sinister design to justify their policy for stifling the DPRK by force of arms and build up international public opinion necessary for forcing the DPRK to disarm itself.
					
					 This proves that dialogue and improved relations oft-repeated by the U.S. is, in actuality, set to solve the issues with the DPRK by force. Now that the U.S. persistently sticks to its hostile policy toward the DPRK backed by military force, the latter is compelled to take strong countermeasures.
					
					 The U.S. warlike forces had better behave with discretion, pondering over the serious consequences to be entailed by their military option.

articles.title: Joint Anti-Japanese Struggle Called for
articles.content:
Joint Anti-Japanese Struggle Called for
Pyongyang, April 7 (KCNA) -- The Japanese reactionaries are obliged to admit the acts of aggression committed by Japan against the Korean people in the past and make apology and reparation for them but they are kicking up a nosier racket of confrontation with the DPRK as the days go by, defending and whitewashing the crimes perpetrated by Japan against humanity and, at the same time, openly pushing ahead with the moves to convert it into a military giant and launch overseas expansion.
					 Rodong Sinmun today says this in a signed article.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 It is none other than Japan that is persistently standing in the way of the six-party talks under the pretext of the "abduction issue" and it is again the Japanese reactionaries who behaved more wickedly than the United States, crying out for "intercepting" the DPRK's satellite after groundlessly describing its launch for peaceful purpose as a "missile launch." 
					
					 Lurking behind this row is a criminal aim to obstruct the peaceful settlement of the nuclear issue and further stir up the atmosphere of confrontation with the DPRK worldwide in a bid to realize their old ambition for reinvasion at any cost. 
					
					 Citing facts to prove that traitor Lee Myung Bak of south Korea steeped in servility to Japan to the marrow of his bones has committed hideous acts of treachery since he came to power, covering up the indelible crimes committed by the Japanese imperialists in the past and encouraging the Japanese reactionaries in their moves for reinvasion. 
					
					 The reality patently proves that if traitors are allowed to stay within the nation, it is impossible to defend even its inviolable territory, to say nothing of its dignity, and they will bring again inescapable disaster and catastrophe to all its members in the end. 
					
					 All Koreans in the north and the south and abroad should clearly see through the danger of the Japanese reactionaries' moves to reinvade the DPRK and the criminal moves of the south Korean conservative ruling forces, their lackeys, and intensify the nationwide struggle for frustrating them.
					
					 They should roundly expose and condemn the Japanese reactionaries' moves for reinvasion and confrontation with the DPRK and lay bare the criminal aims sought by them through those moves. 
					
					  All the compatriots should wage a more dynamic joint anti-Japanese struggle in order to protect the dignity of the Korean nation, powerfully demonstrate the independent spirit of the nation and bring earlier the independent reunification, peace and prosperity.

articles.title: World Health Day Observed
articles.content:
World Health Day Observed
Pyongyang, April 7 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Tuesday dedicates a signed article to World Health Day.
					 WHO, born on April 7, 1948, set the day of its establishment as World Health Day and organizes various events and functions worldwide every year to commemorate the day, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 WHO set "Health facilities in emergencies" as the theme for this year and conducts activities for helping health institutions to play their roles in case of emergency including natural disaster on the occasion of the day.
					
					 Such activities would contribute to solving worldwide difficult problems which threaten the existence of humankind and creating better and more secure health environment as required by the changing environment and the trend of health development in the 21st century.
					
					 Various activities including lectures and briefings according to the theme are underway in the DPRK on the occasion of the day this year.
					
					 The DPRK will as ever discharge its mission and role and strengthen cooperation with the WHO in the noble idea of the organization and thus conduct positive activities to protect and promote the lives and health of humankind, concludes the article.

articles.title: Lee Myung Bak Regime's Moves to Intensify Suppression of Media Castigated
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak Regime's Moves to Intensify Suppression of Media Castigated
Pyongyang, April 7 (KCNA) -- Political parties including the Democratic Labor Party and organizations including the Media Persons' Union of south Korea held a rally in Seoul on April 2 in protest against the puppet gang's suppression of media. 
					 If Lee's evil bills, the evil bills on media, in particular, which his "government" is working hard to railroad through the "National Assembly", this will bring an era of darkness to this land, the speakers at the rally warned, calling for checking the authorities' moves to make a retrogressive revision of laws on media without fail. 
					
					 They vowed to exert all efforts for preserving the impartiality and autonomy of media in the future. 
					
					 A resolution read out there pointed out that the recent reckless moves of the authorities to intensify the suppression of media have reached an extreme phase, adding that the above-said parties and organizations would stage actions to check the NA carriage of evil bills on media by pooling efforts with forces of conscience and mobilizing all available means.  
					
					 The Pastors' Council for Realizing Justice and Peace of south Korea and other religious organizations held a press conference in Seoul on March 31 in protest against the group of traitors' suppression of media. 
					
					 Speakers at the conference warned that the Lee "government" will not be able to escape its doom if it persistently works to deteriorate the situation under the pretext of "security."
					
					 A press release read out at the conference demanded the authorities stop the crackdown upon media and set free the detained media persons at once.

articles.title: Retraction of Unpopular Educational Policy Demanded in South Korea
articles.content:
Retraction of Unpopular Educational Policy Demanded in South Korea
 Pyongyang, April 7 (KCNA) -- Youth organizations of south Korea including the Youth Council for Livelihood and Democracy and the Preparatory Committee for the Youth Association of Kyonggi Province held a press conference outside the Office of Education in Kyonggi Province on April 2 to denounce the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors for its unpopular educational policy.
					 The organizations assailed the Lee Myung Bak "government" for enforcing an educational policy only in favor of a few privileged circles despite the unanimous opposition of people.
					
					 They deplored that since the emergence of the present "government" the education fee has spiraled at private schools, pupils and their parents have been driven into despair because of the "profit-seeking education " and the "education for the privileged circles" enforced by it and those teachers who opposed the unfair educational policy of the authorities have been fired. 
					
					 The organizations urged the present "government" to roll back at once the unpopular educational policy.

articles.title: Halt to Dispatch of Troops Overseas Demanded in S. Korea
articles.content:
Halt to Dispatch of Troops Overseas Demanded in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, April 7 (KCNA) -- Members of the organizations for peace against war of south Korea held a meeting in Seoul on April 4 at which they demanded the puppet authorities halt their moves to dispatch troops overseas, according to MBC of south Korea.
					 The participants in the meeting accused the Lee Myung Bak "government" of recently contemplating the dispatch of its puppet troops to Afghanistan.
					
					 The authorities disclosed the above-said plan instead of working hard to relieve the people whose living has been driven into misery by economic bankruptcy, they deplored, branding their behavior as an absolutely unpardonable act.
					
					 They urged the authorities to halt their moves to dispatch their troops overseas as early as possible.

articles.title: Will to Boost Cooperation with WPK Reiterated
articles.content:
Will to Boost Cooperation with WPK Reiterated
 Pyongyang, April 7 (KCNA) -- The DPRK ambassador to Peru paid a courtesy call on Alberto Moreno, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Peru (Red Motherland) on March 31.
					The general secretary said that his party has long developed the friendly relations with the Workers' Party of Korea which was founded by President Kim Il Sung and is steered by General Secretary Kim Jong Il, reiterating the will to boost the close cooperation between the two parties.
					
					 Our party voices full support and solidarity with the Korean people in their struggle to dynamically accelerate the building of socialism and achieve the reunification of the country in face of threats and blackmail of the U.S. imperialists and their followers, he said, stressing that it is a legitimate right for each country to launch a satellite.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Songun Politics Lauded
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Songun Politics Lauded
Pyongyang, April 7 (KCNA) -- Dilip Barua, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Bangladesh (Marxist-Leninist), released a statement on April 1 on the occasions of the Day of the Sun and the 16th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's election as chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK.
					 The statement noted that the DPRK has turned into a powerful socialist state and the socialist and anti-imperialist independent forces have grown stronger in the international arena thanks to the brilliant ideological and theoretical activities conducted by President Kim Il Sung and his revolutionary practices.
					
					 It stressed that the President was, indeed, the genuine leader of the Korean people and the world revolutionary people struggling for independence.
					
					It was a very significant historic event in accomplishing the cause of global independence that
						 Kim Jong Il was elected chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK by the unanimous desire of all the Korean people, the statement noted.
					
					 It expressed belief that the Songun politics pursued by Kim Jong Il who is successfully carrying forward Kim Il Sung's revolutionary cause would instill greater victory and honor into the Korean people and the world revolutionary people.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun felicita lanzamiento exitoso de "Kwangmyongsong No.2"
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun felicita lanzamiento exitoso de "Kwangmyongsong No.2"
Pyongyang, 7 de abril (ATCC) -- El lanzamiento exitoso del satelite artificial "Kwangmyongsong No.2" deviene un evento historico de mucho significado que manifesto sin reservas el poderio nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, significo el tiro de las salvas de la victoria en la construccion de una gran potencia prospera, infundio en el pueblo coreano el gran orgullo y dignidad nacionales e hizo gran aporte a la paz y la seguridad del mundo.
					  Asi senala el diario Rodong Sinmun en un editorial difundido el dia 7 y continua:
					
					  Mediante ese lanzamiento del satelite, se manifestaron patentemente el poderio de la industria del Juche consolidada aun en medio de severas pruebas y el nivel cientifico-tecnico del pais y se comprobo evidentemente que la construccion de una gran potencia prospera no es una palabra huera.
					
					  El satelite artificial "Kwangmyongsong No.2" y el cohete transportador "Unha-2" son orgullosas creaciones de la Corea del Songun (priorizacion militar) que fueron hechas en 100 % con recursos domesticos desde su diseno, fabricacion y montaje hasta el campo de lanzamiento y la observacion despues del lanzamiento.
					
					  Los cientificos y tecnicos coreanos resolvieron por cuenta propia todos los problemas cientifico-tecnicos surgidos en el desarrollo y el lanzamiento del satelite con su extraordinario espiritu de investigacion y voluntad indoblegable y situaron en el nivel mundial la tecnologia espacial del pais.
					
					  El exitoso lanzamiento del presente satelite es el resultado brillante de la direccion sobre la revolucion mediante el Songun del Dirigente Kim Jong Il, quien presto primordial atencion a las labores para el fortalecimiento del poderio politico y militar y al desarrollo cientifico-tecnico del pais aun bajo las pruebas y adversidades sin precedentes previendo el futuro maravilloso de la patria.
					
					  Tambien es el fruto valioso de la lucha heroica de los fidedignos cientificos y tecnicos quienes dedicaron toda su inteligencia y energias para la prosperidad de la patria apoyando al Partido del Trabajo de Corea con la conviccion revolucionaria y gran entusiasmo patriotico.
					
					  El ejercito y el pueblo de Corea, que conmemoran significativamente el lanzamiento exitoso del "Kwangmyongsong No.2", daran pasos mas grandes al nuevo y gran auge revolucionario para construir sin falta una gran potencia prospera del Juche en el suelo patrio bajo la guia del Songun del Dirigente.

articles.title: Celebran en Corea el "Dia Mundial de la Salud"
articles.content:
Celebran en Corea el "Dia Mundial de la Salud"
						
Pyongyang, 7 de abril (ATCC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 7 en esta capital el acto dedicado al "Dia Mundial de la Salud".
					  En la ocasion participaron los funcionarios del Ministerio de Salud Publica y otros ministerios, las organizaciones de masas, los organos centrales y las instituciones de prensa e informacion y los funcionarios sanitarios de la capital.
					
					  Tambien participaron los miembros de las representaciones de la Organizacion Mundial de la Salud (OMS) y otras organizaciones internacionales en la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					
					  En la ocasion hicieron uso de la palabra el viceministro de Salud Publica, Ri Pong Hun, y el representante de la OMS, Sarveshwar Puri.
					
					  Los oradores senalaron que el tema del "Dia Mundial de la Salud" de este ano "Los organos de salud en los casos emergentes" exhorta a los organos y funcionarios de salud a realizar acciones practicas en las circunstancias emergentes.
					
					  Los servicios suficientes y eficientes de esos organos en los casos emergentes tienen importancia vital para salvar la vida de los habitantes, subrayaron.
					
					  Expresaron la esperanza de que las celebraciones de esa efemeride contribuyan a las actividades de la OMS y la comunidad internacional 
					
					  Acto seguido, los participantes vieron el video sobre "Los organos de salud en los casos emergentes".
					
					  Ademas, se impartio una leccion sobre "las calamidades y los servicios medicos emergentes".
